isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1991) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES FOR 7.3 LITER DIESEL ENGINES - INJECTION PUMP DYNAMIC TIMING - COOLANT TEMPERATURE SENSOR CHECK

svcproc.title: COOLANT TEMPERATURE SENSOR CHECK
svcproc.para: Check the coolant temperature sensor function as follows:

step2.para: Disconnect the HPCA Solenoid connection. Refer to Figure 5.27.
Turn the ignition switch key to the "IGN" position. Refer to Figure 5.29.
Install a test lamp into the connector terminal and clamp to a suitable ground. Refer to Figure 5.30.

figure.caption: Figure 5.30 Check Voltage w/ Coolant Below 85°F Only

step1.para: WITH ENGINE COLD (Coolant temperature below 85° F).

step2.para: The test lamp should light. If not, replace the coolant temperature sensor.

step1.para: WITH ENGINE WARM (Coolant temperature above 140° F).

step2.para: The test lamp should NOT light. If it lights, replace the sensor.

note.para: If there is a complaint of excessive start-up smoke, the coolant temperature sensor must be tested for continuity with the engine below 85°F.

step1.para: Perform timing check A, with the Housing Pressure Cold Advance (HPCA) disconnected from the HPCA terminal. Refer to Figure 5.27. Run the engine at 2000 RPM, no load, and record dynamic timing.
Reconnect the HPCA Solenoid terminal and apply battery voltage using a jumper wire to activate the HPCA Solenoid. Refer to Figure 5.28. Run the engine at 2000 RPM, no load, and record timing.
Calculate the degrees of advance by subtracting the first timing check A, recorded in Step 13, from the second timing check B, recorded in Step 14. The difference equals the degrees of advance.

note.para: Timing Advance should be 2° (minimum) above the first timing check.

step1.para: After the timing operation is complete, reinstall the plastic line pressure sensor cap.

note.para: If the HPCA is functioning and timing specifications cannot be met by adjustment as specified in Step 18, internal pump problems are indicated. Repair or replace the pump as required.

step1.para: Factory Dynamic Timing Procedure: (Refer to Figure 5.31.

important.para: NEW ENGINE AND INJECTION PUMP TIMING IS SET IN TWO STEPS DURING THE PRODUCTION PROCESS.

STEP ONE: INITIAL OR STATIC TIMING IS MARKED AT THE 12:00 POSITION ON THE PUMP FLANGE AND ADAPTER HOUSING. THESE MARKS ARE ONLY USED AS AN APPROXIMATE TIMING SETTING PRIOR TO STEP TWO, DYNAMICALLY TIMING THE ENGINE.

STEP TWO: FINAL TIMING IS DONE DYNAMICALLY. A ROBOTIC DEVICE AUTOMATICALLY ADJUSTS THE INJECTION PUMP POSITION BY ROTATING IT SLIGHTLY (ADVANCE OR RETARD), AND STRIKING NEW MARKS AT THE 10:00 POSITION. THE 12:00 MARKS MAY BE OUT OF ALIGNMENT DUE TO THE AUTOMATIC ROTATION OF THE PUMP DURING THE DYNAMIC TIMING ADJUSTMENT. ONLY THE 10:00 MARKS MUST BE IN ALIGNMENT.

note.para: Later production engines do not have the 12:00 o'clock scribe mark on the pump flange. Service pumps will continue to have a 12:00 o'clock mark as a reference/starting point.

step1.para: ♦ Early Model 7.3 Liter Diesel Engines: Scribe marks are present on the injection pump adapter housing and mounting flange at the 12:00 and 10:00 positions on early production engines. Service fuel injection pumps have a scribe mark on the mounting flange at the 12:00 position.

♦ Late Model 7.3 Liter Diesel Engines: Scribe marks are present on the injection pump adapter housing at the 12:00 and 10:00 positions on late model production engines. Late model production injection pump mounting flanges have a scribe mark at the 10:00 position (and no scribe mark at the 12:00 position). Service fuel injection pumps have a scribe mark on the mounting flange at the 12:00 position (and no mark at the 10:00 position).

note.para: Static timing marks at 12:00 on service pumps or certified shop repaired pumps act as a reference for pump installation and may be misaligned after timing the pump dynamically.

step1.para: ADJUSTMENT - If service requires injection pump timing adjustment, the timing marks at the 10:00 position which were set at the factory may be misaligned within 0.030 in.

step2.para: With the engine off, note the alignment of the 10:00 timing marks. (Factory setting requires perfect alignment).

note.para: If the 10:00 marks are NOT in perfect alignment, timing has been changed. Misalignment of the 10:00 marks by more than 0.030 in. is not permissible.

step2.para: Loosen the injection pump mounting nuts using the injection pump wrench ZTSE-4132. Rotate the injection pump clockwise (as viewed from the front of the engine) to retard and counterclockwise to advance timing. Specified dynamic injection timing is 3.5° ± 2° BTDC (at 2000 RPM) as measured with tool ZTSE-4142 .
Tighten the injection pump mounting nuts. Start the engine and recheck timing to verify timing. Refer to Step 13.
Recheck advance. Refer to Steps 14 and 15.

note.para: If dynamic timing specifications cannot be obtained by adjustment, internal pump problems are indicated and the pump must be repaired or replaced, in accordance with the current warranty policy.

step1.para: PUMP REPLACEMENT - If service requires injection pump replacement, the engine must be retimed dynamically.

step2.para: Use the 12:00 scribe mark found on the service injection pump mounting flange and install the service pump so it aligns with the 12:00 mark on the adapter housing. Refer to CGES-435-* "7.3 Liter Engine Service Manual" for injection pump removal and installation procedures.
Dynamically check pump timing, as described in Steps 13-15 and record the readings.

Adjust the injection pump timing by loosening the injection pump mounting nuts using the injection pump wrench ZTSE-4132. Rotate the injection pump clockwise to advance timing. Tighten the injection pump mounting nuts. Start the engine and verify pump timing as described in Steps 13-15.
When dynamic timing specifications are achieved, scribe a new alignment mark on the injection pump mounting flange at the 10:00 position to align with the mark on the adapter housing.

note.para: The 12:00 marks act only as a reference for installation purposes; they may be misaligned after setting the pump dynamically.
